result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with the victims in this case OR the victims in the read-in case.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
The first *six (6)  months are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining *six (6) months, Court allows release privileges for employment, treatment, and Day Reporting Center purposes only.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" towards the condition time.
**11/30/2015 Honorable M. Joseph Donald-  Modification of straight time from eight months to six months, with  eligibility for DRC after six months straight time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Collins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 11/30/20125:  JOC shall be amended to reflect a modifciation of straight time from eight months to six months, with eligibility for DRC after six months straight time.
Modifying Straight Time Duration; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant asking court to modify straight time provision to 6 months instead of 8 months.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Ronald Collins in court with attorney Darryl Smith.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Michelle S.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 66 MONTHS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 36 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS. 
Credit given for 32 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATEN BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction.  The first 8 months are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 4 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, treatment, and Day Reporting Center purposes only.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" towards the condition time.
* No contact with the victims in this case OR the victims in the read-in case.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Justice Point Pretrial Report.
Copy of letter to the victim during robbery.

Defendant Ronald Collins in court with attorney Darryl Smith.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

**Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum were previously filed.
and Addendum filed by Atty. Darryl Smith on behalf of the defendant.

Statements made.
State requests an adjournment for time to notice the victim in the misdemeanor case.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-15-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Ronald Collins in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM024087  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/11/2015

Defendant Ronald Collins NOT in court; IN CUSTODY.  Attorney Daryl A Kastenson appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.

Atty. Kastenson moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant due to his leaving the Public Defender's office next month.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Kastenson to withdraw.
Atty. Daryl Kastenson is now discharged.
Atty, Kastenson to ensure that new counsel is appointed by the next court date.
Case adjourned to 05-26-2015 at 8;30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Ronald Collins in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Collins in custody.  Joanne Hardtke for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Detective Michael Tanem.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Collins in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Collins in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State's witness was present but had to leave. Defense Counsel did not object to a one day adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Hayat Pharmacy and any employees.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Collins in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Collins in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
